content:
Check:
  any:
    - all:
        - name: DOMAIN
          operator: prefix_matches_regex
          prefix: 2
          value: (AP|ap)
        - name: APID
          operator: not_exists
    - all:
        - name: DOMAIN
          operator: not_prefix_matches_regex
          prefix: 2
          value: (AP|ap)
        - name: STUDYID
          operator: exists
        - name: --SEQ
          operator: exists
        - name: USUBJID
          operator: not_exists
        - name: SPDEVID
          operator: not_exists
        - name: POOLID
          operator: not_exists
Core:
  Id: CORE-000107
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: APID is required in all Associated Persons Data. In addition to STUDYID,
  DOMAIN, and --SEQ being required for all domains based on one of the 3 general observation
  classes, one of USUBJID, APID, SPDEVID, or POOLID must also be present.
Outcome:
  Message: An appropriate subject identifier is not present.  APID is required in
    all Associated Persons Data. In addition to STUDYID, DOMAIN, and --SEQ being required
    for all domains based on one of the 3 general observation classes, one of USUBJID,
    APID, SPDEVID, or POOLID must also be present.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0554
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: STUDYID, DOMAIN, and --SEQ are required in all domains
                  based on one of the 3 general observation classes. Each general
                  class domain must also include at least one of the following subject
                  identifiers USUBJID, SPDEVID, or POOLID.
                Document: Model v2.0
                Section: Identifiers
              - Cited Guidance: The Associated Persons Identifier (APID) will be required
                  in all AP datasets, and will identify records as AP data.'
                Document: Model v2.0
                Section: Associated Persons Data
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: APID is required in all Associated Persons Data. In addition to STUDYID, DOMAIN, and --SEQ being required for all domains based on one of the 3 general observation classes, one of USUBJID, APID, SPDEVID, or POOLID must also be present.

Outcome.Message: An appropriate subject identifier is not present.  APID is required in all Associated Persons Data. In addition to STUDYID, DOMAIN, and --SEQ being required for all domains based on one of the 3 general observation classes, one of USUBJID, APID, SPDEVID, or POOLID must also be present.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: STUDYID, DOMAIN, and --SEQ are required in all domains based on one of the 3 general observation classes. Each general class domain must also include at least one of the following subject identifiers USUBJID, SPDEVID, or POOLID.
The Associated Persons Identifier (APID) will be required in all AP datasets, and will identify records as AP data.'
